term: End suction close coupled water pump
original_definition: 'End suction close coupled water pump' is an end suction water pump of which the motor shaft is extended to become also the pump shaft;
generated_definition: 'End suction close coupled water pump' means a type of water pump that uses a suction mechanism to draw water from a source and directs it through a narrow inlet into a cylindrical chamber, where it is accelerated by a rotating impeller to increase pressure and flow rate, before being discharged through a discharge outlet.

Article 2: ‘End suction close coupled water pump’ (ESCC) is an end suction water pump of which the motor shaft is extended to become also the pump shaft;
